glossentry.glossdef: Guaranteed Bit Rate is used as a parameter for GBR type bearer, and indicates the bandwidth (bit rate) to be guaranteed by the LTE network.
Gateway GPRS Serving Node is an important component of the GPRS network.
The Greenwich Mean Time is a reference point for time zones around the world.
General Packet Radio Service is a packet oriented mobile data service on the 2G and 3G cellular Global System for Mobile communications (GSM).
Number of days or period during which a feature is used after its expiry.
Grafana is an open-source platform for data visualization, monitoring and analysis.
Granted Service Unit is the number of granted units to a given service or rating group.
Graphical User Interface is the graphical interface of a computer that allow users to click and drag objects with a mouse instead of using command line.
It is an interface between OCS and Gateway GPRS support node. OCS provides support to the Gy interface when it interacts with Policy and Charging Enforcement Function (PCEF).
